alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 1:22AM EDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that showers and thunderstorms were gradually decreasing in coverage but were still persisting near Mary Esther, Wright, Fort Walton Beach, and Eglin AFB. Some locations in southeastern Okaloosa county have received 2 to 2.5 inches of rain in the past 1 to 2 hours. Excessive runoff from the heavy rainfall will lead to flooding of low lying areas and some roadways in the flood advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Mary Esther, Ocean City and Cinco Bayou.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
